site_name: LADY BANKES INFANT AND JUNIOR SCHOOL
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the submitted plans and details, namely Window Schedule, 156113 LB020, 156113 LB019 - Third floor plan, W20B15 Typical Double Door, W20B13 Typical Side Hung Door, 156113 LB014, 156113 LB015, 9650G2B D6 Rev. A, 9650G2B D5 Rev. A, 9650G2B D4 Rev. A, 9650G2B D3 Rev. B, 9650G2B D2 Rev. C, 9650G2B D1 Rev. B, 9650G2B S1 Rev. C, 156113 LB016, 156113 LB017, 156113 LB018, 156113 LB019,156113 LB021, 156113 LB001,  Planning and Design and Access Statement and Email dated 27 April 2020 and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Development Management Policies (2020) and the London Plan (2016).

Notwithstanding the approved plans, the type, colour and specification of the new windows to be provided shall exactly match the existing windows currently installed in the front (south east) elevation of the main school building and the windows shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Specifically:
1. The double glazed units shall have 4.6.4 configuration as agreed for the frontage windows;
2. The beading detail shall match that used for the W20 windows previously installed on the main frontage;
3. The windows and all relevant fixtures and fittings, including spacers and gaskets, shall be coloured white to match previously installed windows in the front elevation;
4. All window furniture shall match that previously installed in the front elevation;
6. No trickle vents shall be installed;
7. Window surrounds, heads and cills shall be repaired/replaced to match the ex

Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to commencement of relevant part of the works, details of repair works to the access doors and main entrance shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Where doors are proposed to be replaced, details of all replacement doors shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include scaled drawings no more than 1:10 in scale in scale and where relevant manufacturer information, product type, code and colour.  The access doors shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the special interest of the building and its setting in accordance with Policy HE1 of the Local Plan: Part One (2012), Policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Local Plan: Part Two (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (September 2007) as incorporated into the Hillingdon Local Plan (2012) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan - The Spatial Development Strategy for London consolidated with alterations since 2011 (2016) and national guidance.
description: Replacement of windows to the clerestory, second and third floor levels and the replacement of all access doors at ground floor level, including the main front entrance.
